content: Interesting, and well written post. That said… Between the eager-to-recreate post responses, learnings from the existing bot data you expose, and — I suppose — what have become societal norms around perceived personal worth via follower count, my ideal (albeit optimistic) outcomes from this would be: No one else do, or share this. Please. Let’s face it, gaming the system (and effectively, the humans in that system) cheapens and undermines the actual value of any ‘real’ connection. It’s pretty much automating behaving like a dick.Instagram tighten up the API, specifically set up some algos to spot follow and unfollow behavior from anyone gaming the system to warn, and then suspend them. It’s a slippery slope to twitter quality, and in my view the networks that protect genuine quality over quantity will be the ones that survive and thrive. Personally, my own takeaway is to be more wary about ‘following back’ on Instagram now.
